name: typescript-expert
description: TypeScript and JavaScript language expert covering TypeScript type system, JavaScript runtime behavior, standard library, and Node.js integration for deterministic code generation

metadata.author: TypeScript Official Documentation + MDN JavaScript Documentation

can_do: Generate TypeScript code with correct syntax
Generate JavaScript code with proper runtime behavior
Explain JavaScript runtime behavior (closures, hoisting, prototypes)
Provide correct usage of JavaScript standard library methods
Implement async/await and Promise patterns correctly
Use JavaScript array, object, and string methods appropriately
Use Map, Set, WeakMap, WeakSet correctly
Explain JavaScript event loop and execution model
cannot_do: Suggest coding style preferences beyond TypeScript rules
Provide browser-specific DOM APIs (use separate expert for browser APIs)
Provide Node.js-specific APIs beyond TypeScript integration

boolean.statement: TypeScript boolean type represents true/false values

number.statement: TypeScript number type represents all numeric values (integers and floats)

string.statement: TypeScript string type represents textual data

array.statement: TypeScript arrays can be typed in two ways: Type[] or Array<Type>

tuple.statement: Tuple types allow expressing an array with fixed number of elements whose types are known

enum.statement: Enums allow defining a set of named constants

any.statement: Type 'any' disables type checking for a value

unknown.statement: Type 'unknown' is type-safe counterpart of any

void.statement: Type 'void' represents absence of a value, typically used for functions that don't return

null_and_undefined.statement: TypeScript has both null and undefined types

never.statement: Type 'never' represents values that never occur
never.syntax: function error(message: string): never { throw new Error(message); }

object.syntax: declare function create(o: object | null): void;

variable_annotations.statement: Variables can have explicit type annotations
variable_annotations.optional: TypeScript infers types when not specified

function_parameter_annotations.statement: Function parameters require type annotations in most cases

function_return_annotations.statement: Function return types can be explicitly annotated
function_return_annotations.syntax: function add(a: number, b: number): number { return a + b; }

type_inference.statement: TypeScript automatically infers types when possible

interface_definition.statement: Interfaces define the shape of an object
interface_definition.syntax: interface Person { name: string; age: number; }

optional_properties.statement: Interface properties can be marked as optional with ?

readonly_properties.statement: Properties can be marked as readonly to prevent modification after creation

function_types.syntax: interface SearchFunc { (source: string, subString: string): boolean; }

indexable_types.statement: Interfaces can describe types with index signatures

extending_interfaces.syntax: interface Shape { color: string; } interface Square extends Shape { sideLength: number; }

hybrid_types.statement: Interfaces can describe objects that work as both functions and objects
hybrid_types.syntax: interface Counter { (start: number): string; interval: number; }

type_alias_definition.statement: Type aliases create a new name for a type
type_alias_definition.syntax: type Point = { x: number; y: number; };

union_types.statement: Union types represent a value that can be one of several types

intersection_types.statement: Intersection types combine multiple types into one

type_vs_interface.statement: Type aliases and interfaces are similar but have key differences
differences: Interfaces can be extended and implemented
Types can use unions and intersections
Types are more flexible for complex types

generic_functions.statement: Generic functions work with multiple types while maintaining type safety
generic_functions.syntax: function identity<T>(arg: T): T { return arg; }

generic_classes.statement: Classes can have generic type parameters
generic_classes.syntax: class GenericNumber<T> { zeroValue: T; add: (x: T, y: T) => T; }

generic_constraints.statement: Generic types can be constrained to types with certain properties
generic_constraints.syntax: function getProperty<T, K extends keyof T>(obj: T, key: K) { return obj[key]; }

default_generic_types.statement: Generic types can have default type parameters

class_definition.statement: Classes define blueprints for objects with properties and methods
class_definition.syntax: class Greeter { greeting: string; constructor(message: string) { this.greeting = message; } }

constructors.statement: Constructor is a special function called when creating class instances

inheritance.statement: Classes can inherit from other classes using extends

public.statement: Public members are accessible from anywhere

private.statement: Private members are only accessible within the class

protected.statement: Protected members are accessible within the class and subclasses

readonly_modifier.statement: Readonly properties must be initialized at declaration or in constructor

parameter_properties.statement: Constructor parameters with modifiers automatically create and initialize class properties

abstract_classes.statement: Abstract classes cannot be instantiated and may contain abstract methods
abstract_classes.syntax: abstract class Animal { abstract makeSound(): void; }

static_members.statement: Static members belong to the class itself, not instances

function_types.statement: Functions can be typed with parameter and return types
function_types.syntax: let myAdd: (x: number, y: number) => number;

optional_parameters.statement: Function parameters can be optional using ?

rest_parameters.statement: Rest parameters gather remaining arguments into an array

function_overloads.syntax: function add(a: number, b: number): number; function add(a: string, b: string): string; function add(a: any, b: any): any { return a + b; }

arrow_functions.statement: Arrow functions provide shorter syntax and lexical this binding
arrow_functions.syntax: const add = (x: number, y: number): number => x + y;

named_export.statement: Named exports allow exporting multiple values from a module
named_export.syntax: export const pi = 3.14; export function calculate() { }

default_export.statement: Each module can have one default export

named_import.statement: Import specific exports from a module

namespace_import.statement: Import entire module as a single object

module_resolution.statement: TypeScript uses module resolution strategies to locate modules

partial.statement: Partial<T> makes all properties of T optional

required.statement: Required<T> makes all properties of T required

readonly.statement: Readonly<T> makes all properties of T readonly

record.statement: Record<K, T> constructs type with keys K and values T

pick.statement: Pick<T, K> creates type by picking set of properties K from T

omit.statement: Omit<T, K> creates type by omitting set of properties K from T

exclude.statement: Exclude<T, U> excludes from T types assignable to U

extract.statement: Extract<T, U> extracts from T types assignable to U

nonnullable.statement: NonNullable<T> excludes null and undefined from T

returntype.statement: ReturnType<T> obtains the return type of a function type

parameters.statement: Parameters<T> obtains parameter types of a function type as a tuple

awaited.statement: Awaited<T> unwraps the type from a Promise

conditional_types.statement: Conditional types select one of two types based on a condition

mapped_types.statement: Mapped types transform properties of a type
mapped_types.syntax: type Readonly<T> = { readonly [P in keyof T]: T[P]; }

template_literal_types.statement: Template literal types build new string literal types from existing ones

indexed_access_types.statement: Indexed access types look up a specific property on another type

typeof_operator.statement: typeof operator in type context gets the type of a value
typeof_operator.syntax: let s = 'hello'; type S = typeof s;

keyof_operator.statement: keyof operator takes an object type and produces string or numeric literal union of its keys

target.statement: target specifies the ECMAScript target version

module.statement: module specifies the module code generation method

lib.statement: lib specifies library files to be included in compilation

strict.statement: strict enables all strict type checking options

esModuleInterop.statement: esModuleInterop enables interoperability between CommonJS and ES Modules
esModuleInterop.enables: import * as namespace syntax with CommonJS modules

outDir.statement: outDir specifies output directory for compiled files

rootDir.statement: rootDir specifies root directory of source files

skipLibCheck.statement: skipLibCheck skips type checking of declaration files

forceConsistentCasingInFileNames.statement: forceConsistentCasingInFileNames ensures file name casing is consistent

allowSyntheticDefaultImports.statement: allowSyntheticDefaultImports allows default imports from modules without default export

d_ts_files.statement: Declaration files (.d.ts) provide type information for JavaScript code

declare_keyword.statement: declare keyword describes shapes that exist elsewhere

triple_slash_directives.statement: Triple-slash directives are single-line comments containing XML tags for compiler instructions

type_export.statement: Types can be exported from declaration files

node_types.statement: Node.js types are provided by @types/node package

package_json_types.statement: package.json types field specifies location of type definitions

node_module_resolution.statement: TypeScript uses Node.js module resolution by default

esm_support.statement: TypeScript supports ES modules in Node.js via type: module in package.json

tsconfig_json.statement: tsconfig.json is TypeScript project configuration file

extends.statement: tsconfig.json can extend another configuration file

include_exclude.statement: include and exclude specify files to include or exclude from compilation

files.statement: files specifies an explicit list of files to include

typeof_guards.statement: typeof guards narrow types based on typeof operator

instanceof_guards.statement: instanceof guards check if value is instance of a class

in_operator.statement: in operator checks if property exists in object

custom_type_guards.statement: Custom type guard functions use 'is' predicates
custom_type_guards.syntax: function isFish(pet: Fish | Bird): pet is Fish { return (pet as Fish).swim !== undefined; }

discriminated_unions.statement: Discriminated unions use a common property to narrow types
discriminated_unions.pattern: Common literal property in each type
discriminated_unions.example: type Shape = Circle | Square; each with kind: 'circle' | 'square'

promise_type.statement: Promise<T> represents an asynchronous operation that returns type T

async_function.statement: async functions always return a Promise

await_keyword.statement: await unwraps Promise values in async functions

experimental_decorators.statement: Decorators are experimental feature requiring compiler flag

class_decorators.statement: Class decorators modify or replace class definition

method_decorators.signature: (target: any, propertyKey: string, descriptor: PropertyDescriptor) => void

tsx_files.statement: .tsx files contain TypeScript with JSX syntax

jsx_compiler_option.statement: jsx compiler option controls how JSX is transformed

namespace_merging.statement: Multiple namespace declarations with same name merge

prototype_chain.statement: JavaScript uses prototypal inheritance where objects inherit from other objects
prototype_chain.inheritance: Properties are looked up through prototype chain

this_binding.statement: Value of 'this' depends on how function is called
rules: Method call: this is the object
Arrow function: lexical this from enclosing scope

closures.statement: Closure is function bundled with references to its lexical environment
closures.memory: Outer variables kept alive while closure exists

hoisting.statement: Variable and function declarations are moved to top of scope during compilation
hoisting.var_hoisting: var declarations hoisted, initialized as undefined
hoisting.let_const_hoisting: let/const hoisted but in temporal dead zone

event_loop.statement: JavaScript uses event loop for asynchronous execution

coercion.falsy_values_note: undefined and NaN are also falsy but cannot be represented in JSON arrays

garbage_collection.statement: JavaScript automatically manages memory via garbage collection
garbage_collection.reachability: Objects reachable from roots are kept

array_map.statement: map() creates new array with results of calling function on every element

array_filter.statement: filter() creates new array with elements that pass test function

array_reduce.statement: reduce() executes reducer function on each element, resulting in single output value

array_foreach.statement: forEach() executes function once for each array element
array_foreach.cannot_break: No way to stop or break iteration

array_find.statement: find() returns first element that satisfies test function

array_some.statement: some() tests whether at least one element passes test function

array_every.statement: every() tests whether all elements pass test function

array_slice.statement: slice() returns shallow copy of portion of array

array_splice.statement: splice() changes array contents by removing/replacing/adding elements

array_concat.statement: concat() merges two or more arrays

array_includes.statement: includes() determines whether array includes certain value

array_join.statement: join() creates string by concatenating all array elements

array_flat.statement: flat() creates new array with sub-array elements concatenated

array_flatmap.statement: flatMap() maps each element then flattens result by one level

object_keys.statement: Object.keys() returns array of object's own enumerable property names

object_values.statement: Object.values() returns array of object's own enumerable property values

object_entries.statement: Object.entries() returns array of object's own enumerable [key, value] pairs

object_assign.statement: Object.assign() copies enumerable own properties from source to target

object_seal.statement: Object.seal() seals object preventing additions/deletions but allows modifications

object_create.statement: Object.create() creates new object with specified prototype
object_create.proto: Prototype for new object or null

object_getprototypeof.statement: Object.getPrototypeOf() returns prototype of specified object

object_hasown.statement: Object.hasOwn() determines if object has property as own property

object_defineproperty.statement: Object.defineProperty() defines new or modifies existing property with descriptor

string_includes.statement: includes() determines whether string contains specified substring

string_slice.statement: slice() extracts section of string and returns new string

string_split.statement: split() divides string into array of substrings

string_trim.statement: trim() removes whitespace from both ends of string

string_replace.statement: replace() returns new string with pattern replaced by replacement
string_replace.replaces: Only first match unless global RegExp

string_match.statement: match() retrieves result of matching string against regular expression

string_padstart.statement: padStart() pads string with another string until reaching target length

string_charat.statement: charAt() returns character at specified index

promise_states.statement: Promise has three states: pending, fulfilled, rejected

promise_then.statement: then() attaches callbacks for fulfilled and rejected cases
promise_then.chaining: Return value becomes next promise value

promise_finally.statement: finally() executes callback regardless of promise outcome

promise_all.statement: Promise.all() waits for all promises to fulfill or any to reject
promise_all.use_case: Parallel operations that all must succeed

promise_race.statement: Promise.race() settles as soon as first promise settles

promise_allsettled.statement: Promise.allSettled() waits for all promises to settle
promise_allsettled.returns: Array of objects with status and value/reason
promise_allsettled.use_case: When you need all results regardless of success/failure

promise_any.statement: Promise.any() fulfills when any promise fulfills
promise_any.use_case: First successful result from multiple sources

async_function_return.statement: async functions always return a Promise
async_function_return.implicit_wrapping: Non-promise return values are wrapped in Promise.resolve()

await_behavior.statement: await pauses async function execution until promise settles
await_behavior.returns: Fulfilled value or throws rejected reason
await_behavior.non_promise: await on non-promise returns value immediately

error_types.statement: JavaScript has built-in error types for different error conditions
types: RangeError: Value not in allowed range

error_properties.name: Error type name
error_properties.cause: Optional error that caused this error

iterator_protocol.statement: Iterator protocol defines standard way to produce sequence of values
iterator_protocol.interface: Object with next() method returning {value, done}
iterator_protocol.done: Boolean indicating if iteration is complete

iterable_protocol.statement: Iterable protocol allows objects to define iteration behavior

generator_functions.statement: Generator functions return Generator objects implementing iterator protocol

yield_expression.statement: yield pauses generator and returns value to caller
yield_expression.returns: Value passed to next() on resume

async_generators.statement: Async generator functions return async iterables
async_generators.syntax: async function* gen() { yield await promise; }
async_generators.yields_promises: Each yielded value is wrapped in promise

symbol_purpose.statement: Symbol is primitive type representing unique identifier
symbol_purpose.unique: Each Symbol() call creates unique value

well_known_symbols.statement: Well-known symbols customize built-in JavaScript behavior

symbol_registry.statement: Symbol.for() creates/retrieves symbols from global registry
symbol_registry.shared: Same key returns same symbol across realms

map_features.statement: Map holds key-value pairs and remembers insertion order
map_features.any_key_type: Keys can be any value (objects, functions, primitives)

map_vs_object.statement: Map differs from Object in key handling and iteration
differences: Map: Any key type vs Object: String/Symbol keys
Map: Size property vs Object: manual counting
Map: Better performance for frequent additions/removals

weakmap_features.statement: WeakMap holds weak references to object keys

set_features.statement: Set stores unique values of any type

weakset_features.statement: WeakSet holds weak references to objects
weakset_features.use_case: Tracking object membership without preventing GC

proxy_purpose.statement: Proxy creates wrapper for object with custom behavior for fundamental operations

proxy_traps.statement: Handler object contains trap methods to intercept operations

reflect_purpose.statement: Reflect provides methods for interceptable JavaScript operations

type_correctness.statement: All type annotations must be valid TypeScript types

syntax_validity.statement: Generated code must compile without syntax errors

tsconfig_compliance.statement: Generated code must comply with tsconfig.json settings

required_using_directives.statement: TypeScript uses import statements, not using directives

expression_level.statement: Start with expressions, ensure type correctness

function_level.statement: Construct functions with typed parameters and return

class_level.statement: Build classes with proper access modifiers and inheritance

module_level.statement: Organize into modules with proper exports

basic_interface.title: Basic Interface Definition

generic_function.title: Generic Function

type_guard.title: Custom Type Guard

notes.purpose: Validates MCP service TypeScript code, generates type-safe Node.js projects, and provides comprehensive JavaScript runtime knowledge
notes.maintenance: Update when TypeScript or ECMAScript releases new versions or features
notes.current_focus: TypeScript 5.9+ with Node.js 18+ integration and ECMAScript 2023+ JavaScript runtime behavior
notes.javascript_coverage: 500+ MDN documentation pages scraped covering: runtime behavior (prototypes, closures, hoisting, event loop, coercion), standard library (Array/Object/String/Number methods), async patterns (Promises, async/await, iterators, generators), advanced features (Maps, Sets, WeakMap, WeakSet, Proxy, Reflect, Symbols)

suggestions_patterns.suggestion: Add TypeScript types for parameters and return type
Add explicit type annotations or use type inference with proper typing
Avoid 'any' type - use specific types, 'unknown', or generics
Use Promise<T> return type for async functions
